thread.title: Made up? Jeremy McConnell follows Stephanie Davis on Twitter after acknowledging he's the father of her baby
thread.title_full: Made up? Jeremy McConnell follows Stephanie Davis on Twitter after acknowledging he's the father of her baby - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Made up? Jeremy McConnell follows Stephanie Davis on Twitter after acknowledging he's the father of her baby
text:
Made up? Jeremy McConnell follows Stephanie Davis on Twitter after acknowledging he's the father of her baby It looks like the Irish hunk and his ex-girlfriend might have finally kissed and made up Share Comments By Vicki Newman 01:47, 12 FEB 2017 Celebs Jeremy McConnell has followed Stephanie Davis on Twitter, prompting speculation the pair could be heading for a reconcilliation - or at the very least a drama-free friendship.
The move came hours after the Irish model finally acknowledged that he IS the father of Steph's baby.
Jeremy - who has denied paternity since Stephanie announced she was pregnant - shared an image of baby Caben-Albi George Davis for the first time.
Jez posted an adorable picture of his son alongside the message: "Happiest man alive, my new focus".
He also recently admitted that if he is the dad, he will be prepared to work together with Steph for the sake of their son.
The tattooed hunk met the former Hollyoaks actress last year when they both took part in Celebrity Big Brother .
They fell in love and continued dating on the outside world until things turned sour a few months later.
Read More Stephanie Davis DELETES Jeremy McConnell statement after he takes paternity test on live TV Stephanie Davis and Jeremy McConnell met in CBB last year (Photo: Stephanie Davis / Twitter) Steph soon found out she was pregnant and at the time, Jeremy said it wasn't true.
He then denied the baby was his when it became obvious she was expecting, and said he wanted a paternity test.
Jeremy was seen on This Morning earlier this week having a DNA sample taken, but it is unknown if the test was carried out or what the results were.
However, it seems like Jeremy is making it clear that he is the father and that little Caben will be part of his life.
Jeremy shared this picture of Caben-Albi It comes after Stephanie Davis deleted any trace of the statement she put out after her ex, Jeremy McConnell, took swabs for a DNA test on live TV.
Following the This Morning segment on Thursday, during which Jeremy opened up about not being there for Steph throughout her pregnancy, the ex-Hollyoaks star had tweeted a statement about Jez's treatment of her.
She said she felt "humiliated" by the way in which Jeremy demanded to know whether he was the father of her newborn baby, Caben-Albi, and said he had ruined her pregnancy.
Read More Jeremy McConnell claims Stephanie Davis’ dad’s warning caused him to doubt pregnancy Next Phillip Schofield blasts 'selfish' woman who thin Watch this video again Watch Next Brooklyn Beckham posts a hilarious video of his D 0:32 Stephanie Davis post video of her going into labo 0:09 Dirty Dancing UK - James & Julia first wedding da 1:18 Things you should know about shigellosis 1:11 Homeless man claims Cambridge student burnt £20 t 0:56 Four arrested in southern France for planning a P 0:52 Nioh - PlayStation Experience 2016 Trailer | PS4 1:02 Robo Pilot! Meet the robot that can fly a DRONE b 2:00 Police body camera captures moment teen is fatall 0:46 Girlfriend covers herself in fake blood to shock 3:44 Video will play in Jeremy McConnell given DNA test on This Morning (Photo: Twitter/@Stephdavis77) "Stephanie has felt humiliated by Jeremy denying his own son and foolishly announcing publicly his request for a DNA test," the statement read.
"Jeremy has caused Stephanie massive amounts of stress, pressure and upset throughout her pregnancy, ruining what for most women is one of the most special time[s] of their lives."
It went on: "Jeremy has at no point throughout the pregnancy or birth been in contact directly with Stephanie. Jeremy was categorically not banned from the birth, nor did he ever ask to attend.
Caben was born on January 13 (Photo: Instagram/stephaniedavis88) "Jeremy has been given the option at all times to take part in a DNA test, because of past behaviour Stephanie has requested that this is handled via the correct channels and managed by her solicitor."
The statement also brought up Jeremy's "audacity" at turning the situation "into a media circus" and accused him of trying to handle it "on his terms only".
But Steph has since taken down the statement, plus screengrabs of a previous tweet posted by Jeremy that denied it was his baby.
Mirror Celeb has contacted Stephanie for comment.
 Stephanie Davis Jeremy McConnell
